body_html:
@madhupkumar 's solution worked for me: add /usr/lib/nvidia-375 to my LD_LIBRARY_PATH :

I added
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${CUDA_HOME}/lib64:/usr/lib/nvidia-375

to my ~/.bashrc, then do source bashrc if you want to load tensorflow in an ipython sesh in the same terminal
body_text:
@madhupkumar 's solution worked for me: add /usr/lib/nvidia-375 to my LD_LIBRARY_PATH :
I added
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${CUDA_HOME}/lib64:/usr/lib/nvidia-375
to my ~/.bashrc, then do source bashrc if you want to load tensorflow in an ipython sesh in the same terminal
body:
@madhupkumar 's solution worked for me: add /usr/lib/nvidia-375 to my LD_LIBRARY_PATH :

I added
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${CUDA_HOME}/lib64:/usr/lib/nvidia-375

to my ~/.bashrc, then do `source bashrc` if you want to load tensorflow in an ipython sesh in the same terminal
